extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite    (CLST102 and CLST103) or CLST129 or CLST200 or CLST207 or CLST101, or permission of the Department.

basic.description: A survey of Roman material culture (art, architecture and artifacts) from the reign of Augustus to that of Constantine. An emphasis will be placed on analyzing Roman architecture, sculpture, urban patterns, and objects of daily life in order to better understand the political messages and social experiences of Romans during the Imperial period.
basic.subject: CLST
basic.title: Archaeology of the Roman Empire
